intro: Rhynchospora dissitispicula, commonly known as the scattered-branched spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to reddish-brown flowers. Its reproductive structures are typically wind-pollinated, a common trait among Cyperaceae species. Rhynchospora dissitispicula plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
